variable.name: Catalog_ID
variable.description: Subject ID number assigned by NINDS Repository

variable.name: In_Panel
variable.description: Indicates whether DNA of this subject is included in any panels available through the NINDS Repository catalog.

variable.name: Age
variable.description: Subject's age at sampling

variable.name: Gender
variable.description: Subject's gender

variable.name: Race
variable.description: Subject's race

variable.name: Ethnicity
variable.description: Ethnic category (as reported by subject) - check one: Hispanic or Latino, Not Hispanic or Latino

variable.name: Age_At_Diagnosis
variable.description: Subject's age at time of diagnosis in years, or the month and year the subject was born.

variable.name: Onset_Age
variable.description: The age at which the subjects themselves first noted symptoms of ALS, based on clinician's interview.

variable.name: Clinical_Data_Source
variable.description: The source of the clinical data

variable.name: Clinician_Type
variable.description: Type of clinician who collected the clinical data

variable.name: Country_Origin
variable.description: Subject's country of birth

variable.name: Zip_Abbrev
variable.description: First 3 digits of subject's zip code

variable.name: Atypical Features of ALS/MND:Atypical features of ALS/MND
variable.description: The clinician indicates, in the checkbox, if he/she observes other atypical features (i.e. sensory, autonomic, cerebellar, cognitive, Parkinsonian, sphincter, ocular, other) not normally associated with ALS.

variable.name: EMG Studies:Bulbar
variable.description: The clinician indicates if 'acute' or 'chronic' denervation, or 'acute' and 'chronic' denervation, or 'no denervation' is present in the bulbar regions of the body. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: EMG Studies:Cervical/upper limbs
variable.description: The clinician indicates if 'acute' or 'chronic' denervation, or 'acute' and 'chronic' denervation, or 'no denervation' is present in the cervical region of the body. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: EMG Studies:Lumbosacral/lower limbs
variable.description: The clinician indicates if 'acute' or 'chronic' denervation, or 'acute' and 'chronic' denervation, or 'no denervation' is present in the lumbo-sacral region of the body. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: EMG Studies:Thoracic/chest
variable.description: The clinician indicates if 'acute' or 'chronic' denervation, or 'acute' and 'chronic' denervation, or 'no denervation' is present in the thoracic region of the body. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Family History:ALS/other MND
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that he/she has a blood relative who is known to have a history or diagnosis of ALS. 'Absent' means that he/she does not have a known blood relative with this disorder. If present, the clinician is to determine which blood relatives have this disorder and their relationship to the proband.

variable.name: Family History:Alzheimer's disease
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that he/she has a blood relative who is known to have a history or diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease. 'Absent' means that he/she does not have a known blood relative with this disorder. If present, the clinician is to determine which blood relatives have this disorder and their relationship to the proband.

variable.name: Family History:Other dementia
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that he/she has a blood relative who is known to have a history or diagnosis of dementia. 'Absent' means that he/she does not have a known blood relative with this disorder. If present, the clinician is to determine which blood relatives have this disorder and their relationship to the proband.

variable.name: Family History:Other neurodegenerative disease
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that he/she has a blood relative who is known to have a history or diagnosis of another neurodegenerative disease. 'Absent' means that he/she does not have a known blood relative with any other neurodegenerative disease. If present, the clinician is to determine which blood relatives have a neurodegenerative disease and their relationship to the proband.

variable.name: Family History:Parkinson's disease
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that he/she has a blood relative who is known to have a history or diagnosis of Parkinson's disease. 'Absent' means that he/she does not have a known blood relative with this disorder. If present, the clinician is to determine which blood relatives have this disorder and their relationship to the proband.

variable.name: Genetics:Other mutation
variable.description: The clinician indicates if testing for any genetic mutation predisposing the subject to ALS was done; if so, were any gene mutations present or not?

variable.name: Genetics:SOD-1 mutation
variable.description: The clinician indicates if the subject underwent genetic testing for a SOD-1 mutation. If tests were completed, was a gene mutation present or not?

variable.name: Longitudinal Data: Is this data Longitudinal (Follow-Up) Data?
variable.description: Is the data longitudinal or an initial assessment?

variable.name: Medical History:Alzheimer's disease
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of Alzheimer's disease. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disease.

variable.name: Medical History:Ataxia
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of ataxia. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disease.

variable.name: Medical History:Autism
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of autism. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disease.

variable.name: Medical History:Bipolar (manic-depressive)
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of bipolar disorder. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Brain aneurysm
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of brain aneurysm. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Cancer
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of cancer. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Dementia
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of dementia. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Depression
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of depression. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Diabetes
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of diabetes. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Dystonia
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of dystonia. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Epilepsy
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of epilepsy. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Heart disease
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of heart disease. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Hypertension
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of hypertension. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Multiple sclerosis
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of multiple sclerosis. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Muscle disease
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of muscle disease. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Parkinson's
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of Parkinson's disease. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Schizophrenia
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of schizophrenia. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Stroke
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of stroke. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of the disorder.

variable.name: Medical History:Suicide/Attempt
variable.description: 'Present' means that the individual subject indicates during clinician's interview that there is a medical history of attempted suicide. 'Absent' means that the subject does not have a medical history of attempted suicide.

variable.name: Optional data:Escorial criteria
variable.description: Escorial criteria: definite, probable, lab-supported probable, possible, suspected; reference: Brooks BR, Miller RG, Swash M, Munsat TL. El Escorial revisited: revised criteria for the diagnosis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Amyotroph. Lateral Scler. Other Motor Neuron Disord. 2000; 1:293-299. [PMID: 11464847]

variable.name: Optional data:Handedness
variable.description: The hand preference of the subject; the subject's dominant hand.

variable.name: Optional data:smoking history
variable.description: A record of an individual's background with regard to smoking tobacco. This would include such factors as start date, end date (if applicable), number of cigarettes smoked, attempts to quit, and others.

variable.name: Primary Clinical Diagnosis:Primary clinical diagnosis
variable.description: The clinician indicates which type of MND the subject has by choosing one of the offered diagnoses (ALS, progressive muscular atrophy, primary lateral sclerosis, other), or by writing in the type of MND if the best diagnosis is not offered.

variable.name: Secondary Neurological Diagnosis:Secondary neurological diagnoses
variable.description: The clinician indicates whether the patient has fronto-temporal dementia (or any other neurological impairment, or NA).

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Lower Motor Neuron Signs-Bulbar
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' lower motor neuron signs in the bulbar region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Lower Motor Neuron Signs-Cervical/upper limbs
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' lower motor neuron signs in the cervical region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Lower Motor Neuron Signs-Lumbosacral/lower limbs
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' lower motor neuron signs in the lumbo-sacral region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Lower Motor Neuron Signs-Thoracic/chest
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' lower motor neuron signs in the thoracic region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Upper Motor Neuron Signs-Bulbar
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' upper motor neuron signs in the bulbar region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Upper Motor Neuron Signs-Cervical/upper limbs
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' upper motor neuron signs in the cervical region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Upper Motor Neuron Signs-Lumbosacral/lower limbs
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' upper motor neuron signs in the lumbo-sacral region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Signs Supporting Diagnosis:Upper Motor Neuron Signs-Thoracic/chest
variable.description: The clinician indicates if and where there are 'definite', 'indeterminate', or 'absent' upper motor neuron signs in the thoracic region. If the region was not examined, the clinician indicates 'not tested'.

variable.name: Site of Symptom Onset:site of symptom onset
variable.description: The clinician indicates the site of onset of the progressive weakness (i.e. bulbar, truncal, generalized, respiratory, limb).

variable.name: Treatment:Current treatment
variable.description: The clinician indicates the treatment that is currently applied (Riluzole, percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy, non-invasive positive pressure ventilation, tracheotomy, other).
